intro: Conophytum microstoma, commonly known as the miniature stone plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rock-like appearance. The plant features fleshy, paired leaves that are typically green with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. Conophytum microstoma is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water to thrive.
